name: src/core/effect-composer.js
EffectComposer
description:
The EffectComposer may be used in place of a normal WebGLRenderer.

The auto clear behaviour of the provided renderer will be disabled to prevent
unnecessary clear operations.

It is common practice to use a {@link RenderPass} as the first pass to
automatically clear the screen and render the scene to a texture for further
processing.

params.name: renderer
params.description: The renderer that should be used.

params.name: options.depthBuffer
params.description: Whether the main render targets should have a depth buffer.

params.name: options.stencilBuffer
params.description: Whether the main render targets should have a stencil buffer.

params.name: options.depthTexture
params.description: Set to true if one of your passes relies on a depth texture.

name: renderer
description:
The renderer.

You may replace the renderer at any time by using
{@link EffectComposer#replaceRenderer}.

name: readBuffer
description:
The read buffer.

Reading from and writing to the same render target should be avoided.
Therefore, two seperate yet identical buffers are used.

name: copyPass
description: A copy pass used for copying masked scenes.

name: depthTexture
description: The depth texture of the read and write buffers.

name: depthTexture
description:
The read and write buffers share a single depth texture. Depth will be
written to this texture when something is rendered into one of the buffers
and the involved materials have depth write enabled.

You may enable this mechanism during the instantiation of the composer or
by assigning a DepthTexture instance later on. You may also disable it by
assigning null.

name: replaceRenderer
description:
Replaces the current renderer with the given one. The DOM element of the
current renderer will automatically be removed from its parent node and the
DOM element of the new renderer will take its place.

The auto clear mechanism of the provided renderer will be disabled.

Switching between renderers allows you to dynamically enable or disable
antialiasing.

name: createBuffer
description:
Creates a new render target by replicating the renderer's canvas.

The created render target uses a linear filter for texel minification and
magnification. Its render texture format depends on whether the renderer
uses the alpha channel. Mipmaps are disabled.

params.name: depthBuffer
params.description: Whether the render target should have a depth buffer.

params.name: stencilBuffer
params.description: Whether the render target should have a stencil buffer.

params.name: depthTexture
params.description: Whether the render target should have a depth texture.

return.description: A new render target that equals the renderer's canvas.

name: addPass
description: Adds a pass, optionally at a specific index.

params.name: index
params.description: An index at which the pass should be inserted.

name: render
description: Renders all enabled passes in the order in which they were added.

params.name: delta
params.description: The time between the last frame and the current one in seconds.

name: setSize
description:
Sets the size of the buffers and the renderer's output canvas.

Every pass will be informed of the new size. It's up to each pass how that
information is used.

If no width or height is specified, the render targets and passes will be
updated with the current size of the renderer.

name: reset
description: Resets this composer by deleting all passes and creating new buffers.

params.name: renderTarget
params.description: A new render target. If none is provided, the settings of the renderer will be used.

name: dispose
description:
Destroys all passes and render targets.

This method deallocates all render targets, textures and materials created
by the passes. It also deletes this composer's frame buffers.

params.name: renderTarget
params.description: A new render target. If none is provided, the composer will become inoperative.

name: src/core/index.js
src/index.js
content:
/**
 * Exposure of the library components.
 *
 * @module postprocessing
 */

export { EffectComposer } from "./core";

export {
	BloomPass,
	BlurPass,
	BokehPass,
	Bokeh2Pass,
	ClearPass,
	ClearMaskPass,
	DepthPass,
	DotScreenPass,
	FilmPass,
	GlitchMode,
	GlitchPass,
	GodRaysPass,
	MaskPass,
	Pass,
	PixelationPass,
	RenderPass,
	SavePass,
	ShaderPass,
	ShockWavePass,
	SMAAPass,
	TexturePass,
	ToneMappingPass
} from "./passes";

export {
	AdaptiveLuminosityMaterial,
	BokehMaterial,
	Bokeh2Material,
	CombineMaterial,
	ConvolutionMaterial,
	CopyMaterial,
	DepthMaterial,
	DotScreenMaterial,
	FilmMaterial,
	GlitchMaterial,
	GodRaysMaterial,
	KernelSize,
	LuminosityMaterial,
	PixelationMaterial,
	ShockWaveMaterial,
	SMAABlendMaterial,
	SMAAColorEdgesMaterial,
	SMAAWeightsMaterial,
	ToneMappingMaterial
} from "./materials";

name: src/materials/adaptive-luminosity.js
constructor
description: Constructs a new adaptive luminosity material.

name: src/materials/bokeh.js
BokehMaterial
description:
Depth of Field shader (Bokeh).

Original shader code by Martins Upitis:
 http://artmartinsh.blogspot.com/2010/02/glsl-lens-blur-filter-with-bokeh.html

params.name: options.aperture
params.description: Camera aperture scale. Bigger values for shallower depth of field.

name: adoptCameraSettings
description: Adopts the settings of the given camera.

name: src/materials/bokeh2.js
Bokeh2Material
description:
Depth of Field shader version 2.4.

Original shader code by Martins Upitis:
 http://blenderartists.org/forum/showthread.php?237488-GLSL-depth-of-field-with-bokeh-v2-4-(update)

params.name: options.showFocus
params.description: Whether the focus point should be highlighted.

params.name: options.manualDoF
params.description: Enables manual depth of field blur.

params.name: options.pentagon
params.description: Enable to use a pentagonal shape to scale gathered texels.

params.name: options.shaderFocus
params.description: Disable if you compute your own focalDepth (in metres!).

params.name: options.noise
params.description: Disable if you don't want noise patterns for dithering.

name: adoptCameraSettings
description: Adopts the near and far plane and the focal length of the given camera.

name: src/materials/combine.js
CombineMaterial
description:
A material for combining two textures.

This material supports the two blend modes Add and Screen.

In Screen mode, the two textures are effectively projected on a white screen
simultaneously. In Add mode, the textures are simply added together which
often produces undesired, washed out results.

params.name: screenMode
params.description: Whether the screen blend mode should be used.

name: src/materials/convolution.js
ConvolutionMaterial
description:
An optimised convolution shader material.

Based on the GDC2003 Presentation by Masaki Kawase, Bunkasha Games:
 Frame Buffer Postprocessing Effects in DOUBLE-S.T.E.A.L (Wreckless)
and an article by Filip Strugar, Intel:
 An investigation of fast real-time GPU-based image blur algorithms

Further modified according to Apple's
[Best Practices for Shaders](https://goo.gl/lmRoM5).

properties.name: VERY_SMALL
properties.description: A very small kernel that matches a 7x7 Gauss blur kernel.

properties.name: SMALL
properties.description: A small kernel that matches a 15x15 Gauss blur kernel.

properties.name: MEDIUM
properties.description: A medium sized kernel that matches a 23x23 Gauss blur kernel.

properties.name: LARGE
properties.description: A large kernel that matches a 35x35 Gauss blur kernel.

properties.name: VERY_LARGE
properties.description: A very large kernel that matches a 63x63 Gauss blur kernel.

properties.name: HUGE
properties.description: A huge kernel that matches a 127x127 Gauss blur kernel.

name: src/materials/copy.js
src/materials/depth.js
adoptCameraSettings
description: Adopts the settings of the given camera.

name: src/materials/dot-screen.js
constructor
description: Constructs a new dot screen material.

params.name: average
params.description: Whether the shader should output the colour average (black and white).

name: src/materials/film.js
FilmMaterial
description:
A cinematic shader that provides the following effects:
 - Film Grain
 - Scanlines
 - Vignette
 - Greyscale
 - Sepia

Original scanlines algorithm by Pat "Hawthorne" Shearon.
 http://www.truevision3d.com/forums/showcase/staticnoise_colorblackwhite_scanline_shaders-t18698.0.html

Optimised scanlines and noise with intensity scaling by Georg "Leviathan"
Steinrohder. This version was provided under a Creative Commons Attribution
3.0 License: http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0.

The sepia effect is based on:
 https://github.com/evanw/glfx.js

The vignette code is based on PaintEffect postprocess from ro.me:
 http://code.google.com/p/3-dreams-of-black/source/browse/deploy/js/effects/PaintEffect.js

params.name: options
params.description: The options. Disabled effects will not be included in the final shader and have no negative impact on performance.

params.name: options.greyscale
params.description: Enable greyscale effect. Greyscale and sepia are mutually exclusive.

params.name: options.sepia
params.description: Enable sepia effect. Greyscale and sepia are mutually exclusive.

params.name: options.eskil
params.description: Use Eskil's vignette approach. The default looks dusty while Eskil looks burned out.

params.name: options.screenMode
params.description: Whether the screen blend mode should be used for noise and scanlines. Both of these effects are computed independently.

params.name: options.greyscaleIntensity
params.description: The intensity of the greyscale effect.

params.name: options.sepiaIntensity
params.description: The intensity of the sepia effect.

params.name: options.vignetteOffset
params.description: The offset of the vignette effect.

params.name: options.vignetteDarkness
params.description: The darkness of the vignette effect.

name: src/materials/glitch.js
GlitchMaterial
description:
A glitch shader material.

Reference:
 https://github.com/staffantan/unityglitch

name: src/materials/god-rays.js
GodRaysMaterial
description:
A crepuscular rays shader material.

References:

Thibaut Despoulain, 2012:
 [(WebGL) Volumetric Light Approximation in Three.js](
 http://bkcore.com/blog/3d/webgl-three-js-volumetric-light-godrays.html)

Nvidia, GPU Gems 3, 2008:
 [Chapter 13. Volumetric Light Scattering as a Post-Process](
 https://developer.nvidia.com/gpugems/GPUGems3/gpugems3_ch13.html)

name: constructor
description: Constructs a new god rays material.

name: src/materials/index.js
src/materials/luminosity.js
LuminosityMaterial
description:
A luminosity shader material.

This shader produces a greyscale luminance map. It can also be configured to
output colours that are scaled with their respective luminance value.
Additionally, a range may be provided to mask out undesired texels.

The alpha channel will remain unaffected in all cases.

Luminance range reference:
 https://cycling74.com/2007/05/23/your-first-shader/#.Vty9FfkrL4Z

params.name: color
params.description: Defines whether the shader should output colours scaled with their luminance value.

params.name: range
params.description: If provided, the shader will mask out texels that aren't in the specified luminance range.

name: src/materials/pixelation.js
PixelationMaterial
description:
A pixelation shader material.

Original shader code by Robert Casanova:
 https://github.com/robertcasanova/pixelate-shader

name: granularity
description: A higher value yields coarser visuals.

name: src/materials/shock-wave.js
ShockWaveMaterial
description:
A shock wave shader material.

Based on a Gist by Jean-Philippe Sarda:
 https://gist.github.com/jpsarda/33cea67a9f2ecb0a0eda

name: constructor
description: Constructs a new shock wave material.

This material is used to render the final antialiasing.

constructor

name: src/passes/bloom.js
BloomPass
description:
A bloom pass.

This pass renders a scene with superimposed blur by utilising the fast Kawase
convolution approach.

params.name: options.resolutionScale
params.description: The render texture resolution scale, relative to the screen render size.

params.name: options.intensity
params.description: The strength of the bloom effect.

params.name: options.distinction
params.description: The luminance distinction factor. Raise this value to bring out the brighter elements in the scene.

params.name: options.screenMode
params.description: Whether the screen blend mode should be used for combining the bloom texture with the scene colors.

name: needsSwap
description: This pass renders to the write buffer.

name: resolutionScale
description: You need to call {@link EffectComposer#setSize} after changing this value.

name: intensity
description: The overall intensity of the effect.

name: render
description:
Renders the effect.

Extracts a luminance map from the read buffer, blurs it and combines it
with the read buffer.

name: initialise
description: Adjusts the format of the render targets.

params.name: alpha
params.description: Whether the renderer uses the alpha channel or not.

name: setSize
description: Updates this pass with the renderer's size.

name: src/passes/blur.js

params.name: options.resolutionScale
params.description: The render texture resolution scale, relative to the screen render size.

name: needsSwap
description: This pass renders to the write buffer.

name: resolutionScale
description:
The resolution scale.

You need to call {@link EffectComposer#setSize} after changing this value.

name: initialise
description: Adjusts the format of the render targets.

params.name: alpha
params.description: Whether the renderer uses the alpha channel or not.

name: setSize
description: Updates this pass with the renderer's size.

name: src/passes/bokeh.js
BokehPass
description:
A Depth of Field (DoF) pass using a bokeh shader.

This pass requires a {@link EffectComposer#depthTexture}.

params.name: camera
params.description: The main camera. Used to obtain the aspect ratio and the near and far plane settings.

params.name: options.aperture
params.description: Camera aperture scale. Bigger values for shallower depth of field.

name: needsSwap
description: This pass renders to the write buffer.

name: setSize
description: Updates this pass with the renderer's size.

name: src/passes/bokeh2.js
Bokeh2Pass
description:
An advanced Depth of Field (DoF) pass.

Yields more realistic results but is also more demanding.

This pass requires a {@link EffectComposer#depthTexture}.

params.name: camera
params.description: The main camera. Used to obtain the focal length and the near and far plane settings.

params.name: options.samples
params.description: The amount of samples per ring.

params.name: options.showFocus
params.description: Whether the focus point should be highlighted.

params.name: options.manualDoF
params.description: Enables manual depth of field blur.

params.name: options.pentagon
params.description: Enable to use a pentagonal shape to scale gathered texels.

params.name: options.shaderFocus
params.description: Disable if you compute your own focalDepth (in metres!).

params.name: options.noise
params.description: Disable if you don't want noise patterns for dithering.

name: needsSwap
description: This pass renders to the write buffer.

name: setSize
description: Updates this pass with the renderer's size.

name: src/passes/clear-mask.js
ClearMaskPass
description: A pass that disables the stencil mask.

name: constructor
description: Constructs a new clear mask pass.

name: src/passes/clear.js
color
description: Used for saving the original clear color of the renderer.

name: ClearPass
description:
A clear pass.

You can prevent specific buffers from being cleared by setting either the
autoClearColor, autoClearStencil or autoClearDepth properties of the renderer
to false.

name: render
description: Clears the read buffer or the screen.

name: src/passes/depth.js
DepthPass
description:
A depth pass.

Reads the depth from a depth texture and renders it.

This pass requires a {@link EffectComposer#depthTexture}.

params.name: camera
params.description: The main camera. Used to obtain the near and far plane settings.

name: needsSwap
description: This pass renders to the write buffer.

constructor

params.name: options.scale
params.description: The scale of the overall effect.

params.name: options.average
params.description: Whether the shader should output a colour average (black and white).

name: needsSwap
description: This pass renders to the write buffer.

name: setSize
description: Updates this pass with the renderer's size.

name: src/passes/film.js
FilmPass
description:
A film pass.

Provides various cinematic effects.

params.name: options
params.description: The options. Disabled effects have no negative impact on performance.

params.name: options.greyscale
params.description: Enable greyscale effect. Greyscale and sepia are mutually exclusive.

params.name: options.sepia
params.description: Enable sepia effect. Greyscale and sepia are mutually exclusive.

params.name: options.eskil
params.description: Use Eskil's vignette approach. The default looks dusty while Eskil looks more burned out.

params.name: options.screenMode
params.description: Whether the screen blend mode should be used for noise and scanlines.

params.name: options.scanlineDensity
params.description: The number of scanlines in percent, relative to the screen height.

params.name: options.greyscaleIntensity
params.description: The intensity of the greyscale effect.

params.name: options.sepiaIntensity
params.description: The intensity of the sepia effect.

params.name: options.vignetteOffset
params.description: The offset of the vignette effect.

params.name: options.vignetteDarkness
params.description: The darkness of the vignette effect.

name: needsSwap
description: This pass renders to the write buffer.

name: scanlineDensity
description:
The amount of scanlines in percent, relative to the screen height.

You need to call {@link EffectComposer#setSize} after changing this value.

name: setSize
description: Adjusts the scanline count using the renderer's height.

name: src/passes/glitch.js
randomInt
description: Returns a random integer in the specified range.

name: randomFloat
description: Returns a random float in the specified range.

params.name: options.perturbMap
params.description: A perturbation map. If none is provided, a noise texture will be created.

params.name: options.dtSize
params.description: The size of the generated noise map. Will be ignored if a perturbation map is provided.

name: needsSwap
description: This pass renders to the write buffer.

name: counter
description: Counter for glitch activation and deactivation.

name: breakPoint
description: A random break point for the sporadic glitch activation.

name: perturbMap
description: Assigning a new perturbation map does not destroy the current one!

name: generatePerturbMap
description: Destroys the current perturbation map and replaces it with a new one.

name: src/passes/god-rays.js
constructor
description: Constructs a new god rays pass.

params.name: options.density
params.description: The density of the light rays.

params.name: options.clampMax
params.description: An upper bound for the saturation of the overall effect.

params.name: options.intensity
params.description: A constant factor for additive blending.

params.name: options.resolutionScale
params.description: The render texture resolution scale, relative to the screen render size.

params.name: options.samples
params.description: The number of samples per pixel.

params.name: options.screenMode
params.description: Whether the screen blend mode should be used for combining the god rays texture with the scene colors.

name: needsSwap
description: This pass renders to the write buffer.

name: lightScene
description: A scene that only contains the light source.

name: renderPassLight
description: A pass that only renders the light source.

name: renderPassMask
description: A pass that renders the masked scene over the light.

name: renderTargetMask
description: A render target for the masked light scene.

name: screenPosition
description: The light position in screen space.

name: resolutionScale
description: You need to call {@link EffectComposer#setSize} after changing this value.

name: intensity
description: The overall intensity of the effect.

name: samples
description: The number of samples per pixel.

name: samples
description:
This value must be carefully chosen. A higher value directly increases the
GPU load.

name: render
description:
Renders the scene.

The god rays pass has four phases:

Mask Phase:
 First, the light source is rendered. Then the scene is rendered into the
 same buffer using a mask override material with depth test enabled.

Preliminary Blur Phase:
 The masked scene is blurred.

God Rays Phase:
 The blurred scene is blurred again, but this time along radial lines
 towards the light source.

Composite Phase:
 The final result is combined with the read buffer.

name: initialise
description: Adjusts the format of the render targets.

params.name: alpha
params.description: Whether the renderer uses the alpha channel or not.

name: setSize
description: Updates this pass with the renderer's size.

name: src/passes/index.js
src/passes/mask.js
src/passes/pass.js
Pass
description:
An abstract pass.

Passes that do not rely on the depth buffer should explicitly disable the
depth test and depth write in their respective shader materials.

This class implements a {@link Pass#dispose} method that frees memory on
demand.

params.name: quad
params.description: A quad that fills the screen to render 2D filter effects. Set this to null, if you don't need it (see {@link RenderPass}).

name: quad
description:
A quad mesh that fills the screen.

Assign your shader material to this mesh!

name: needsSwap
description:
Indicates whether the read and write buffers should be swapped after this
pass has finished rendering.

Set this to true if this pass renders to the write buffer so that a
following pass can find the result in the read buffer.

name: render
description:
Renders the effect.

This is an abstract method that must be overridden.

params.name: readBuffer
params.description: A read buffer. Contains the result of the previous pass.

params.name: writeBuffer
params.description: A write buffer. Normally used as the render target when the read buffer is used as input.

params.name: maskActive
params.description: Indicates whether a stencil test mask is active or not.

throws.description: An error is thrown if the method is not overridden.

name: setSize
description:
Updates this pass with the renderer's size.

You may override this method in case you want to be informed about the main
render size.

The {@link EffectComposer} calls this method before this pass is
initialised and every time its own size is updated.

name: initialise
description:
Performs initialisation tasks.

By overriding this method you gain access to the renderer. You'll also be
able to configure your custom render targets to use the appropriate format
(RGB or RGBA).

The provided renderer can be used to warm up special off-screen render
targets by performing a preliminary render operation.

The {@link EffectComposer} calls this method when this pass is added to its
queue.

params.name: alpha
params.description: Whether the renderer uses the alpha channel or not.

name: dispose
description:
Performs a shallow search for properties that define a dispose method and
deletes them. The pass will be inoperative after this method was called!

Disposable objects:
 - render targets
 - materials
 - textures

The {@link EffectComposer} calls this method when it is being destroyed.
You may, however, use it independently to free memory when you are certain
that you don't need this pass anymore.

name: src/passes/pixelation.js
needsSwap
description: This pass renders to the write buffer.

name: granularity
description: A higher value yields coarser visuals.

name: setSize
description: Updates this pass with the renderer's size.

name: src/passes/render.js
RenderPass
description:
A pass that renders a given scene directly on screen or into the read buffer
for further processing.

params.name: camera
params.description: The camera to use to render the scene.

params.name: options.overrideMaterial
params.description: An override material for the scene.

params.name: options.clearDepth
params.description: Whether depth should be cleared explicitly.

params.name: options.clear
params.description: Whether all buffers should be cleared.

name: clearDepth
description: Indicates whether the depth buffer should be cleared explicitly.

name: clear
description:
Indicates whether the color, depth and stencil buffers should be cleared.

Even with clear set to true you can prevent specific buffers from being
cleared by setting either the autoClearColor, autoClearStencil or
autoClearDepth properties of the renderer to false.

name: src/passes/save.js
SavePass
description: A pass that renders the result from a previous pass to another render target.

params.name: renderTarget
params.description: The render target to use for saving the read buffer.

params.name: resize
params.description: Whether the render target should adjust to the size of the read/write buffer.

name: resize
description:
Indicates whether the render target should be resized when the size of
the composer's read/write buffer changes.

name: initialise
description: Adjusts the format of the render target.

params.name: alpha
params.description: Whether the renderer uses the alpha channel or not.

name: setSize
description: Updates this pass with the renderer's size.

name: src/passes/shader.js
ShaderPass
description:
A shader pass.

Used to render any shader material as a 2D filter.

name: needsSwap
description: This pass renders to the write buffer.

name: material
description: The shader material to use for rendering.

name: textureID
description: The name of the color sampler uniform of the given material.

name: screenPosition

name: speed
description: The speed of the shock wave animation.

name: active
description: Indicates whether the shock wave animation is active.

name: setSize
description: Updates this pass with the renderer's size.

name: src/passes/smaa.js
SMAAPass

Subpixel Morphological Antialiasing (SMAA) v2.8.

Preset: SMAA 1x Medium (with color edge detection).

params.name: Image
params.description: This pass requires an Image class to create internal textures. Provide window.Image in a browser environment.

name: needsSwap
description: This pass renders to the write buffer.

name: renderTargetColorEdges
description: A render target for the color edge detection.

name: renderTargetWeights
description: A render target for the SMAA weights.

name: colorEdgesMaterial
description: SMAA color edge detection shader material.

name: setSize
description: Updates this pass with the renderer's size.

name: src/passes/texture.js
TexturePass
description: A pass that renders a given texture.

name: copyMaterial
description: A copy shader material used for rendering to texture.

name: src/passes/tone-mapping.js
ceil2
description: Rounds the given number up to the next power of two.

name: ToneMappingPass
description:
A tone mapping pass that supports adaptive luminosity.

If adaptivity is enabled, this pass generates a texture that represents the
luminosity of the current scene and adjusts it over time to simulate the
optic nerve responding to the amount of light it is receiving.

Reference:
 GDC2007 - Wolfgang Engel, Post-Processing Pipeline
 http://perso.univ-lyon1.fr/jean-claude.iehl/Public/educ/GAMA/2007/gdc07/Post-Processing_Pipeline.pdf

name: constructor
description: Constructs a new tone mapping pass.

params.name: options.adaptive
params.description: Whether the tone mapping should use an adaptive luminance map.

name: needsSwap
description: This pass renders to the write buffer.

name: renderTargetLuminosity
description: The render target for the current luminosity.

name: renderTargetAdapted
description: The render target for adapted luminosity.

name: renderTargetPrevious
description: A render target that holds a copy of the adapted limonosity.

name: copyMaterial
description: Copy shader material used for saving the luminance map.

name: resolution
description: The resolution of the render targets.

name: resolution
description:
The resolution of the render targets. Must be a power of two and will be
rounded up if it isn't.

name: adaptive
description: Whether this pass uses adaptive luminosity.

name: adaptive
description: Whether this pass should use adaptive luminosity.

name: initialise
description: Renders something into the previous luminosity texture.
